The master said,
You wet the bed with your eyes open.
I'll hit you.
Chan Master Huai said to Xiu Yuan Tong,
Yuan, Qingzhou, Jing, Fujian, and you three,
you will uphold our school.
The rest all receive the Way according to their capacities.
Chan Master Dou Suo Yue,
was the head monk at Dao Wu.
At that time, Old Chan Master Zhi was residing at Yun Gai.
One day, Yue led several dozen patched-robed monks to visit Zhi.
Before a few sentences were spoken,
Zhi knew the depth of what Yue had accumulated.
He laughed and said,
Looking at the head monk's extraordinary bearing,
why does his speech and breath resemble a drunkard?
His face was flushed and he broke out in a sweat.
He said, I wish the Venerable would not begrudge his compassion.
After speaking with him for a while,
[Daokai] again pricked him with the awl.
[Zhizhao] was at a loss.
He then led his disciples to consult [Daokai] about entering the room.
[Daokai] laughed and said,
You are the head of the assembly and a Dharma speaker.
If I were to speak to you based on my limited knowledge and experience,
what benefit would it be to you?
[Zhizhao] earnestly requested [Daokai] to speak to him again.
[Daokai] said,
This old monk has no blessings.
My teachings are not trusted by people.
If I were to accept your prostrations as the head monk,
others would certainly slander me.
In the end, [Daokai] did not agree.
He then asked [Zhizhao],
Have you ever met Chan Master Fachang Yu?
[Zhizhao] said, I have read his recorded sayings and understand them myself.
Is it necessary to wish to meet him?
[Daokai] asked again,
Have you ever met Chan Master Dongshan Wen?
[Zhizhao] said, The son from Guanzhong.
No head.
Dragging a piece of cloth skirt, stinking of urine.
What long-lasting virtue does he have?
Zhi said:
The chief seat, just contemplate the smell of urine.
Yue followed the teaching and went to Dongshan to rely on him.
Before long, he deeply understood the profound meaning.
He went to see Lao Zhi again.
Zhi said:
After the chief seat saw the girl from Guanzhong,
how is the great matter?
Yue said:
If I had not received the instruction from the master,
I would have almost missed my whole life.
He then burned incense and expressed his gratitude.
Later, he left the world and succeeded to Dongshan's Dharma.
He always warned his disciples:
Yun'gai's words of pointing to seeing Dongshan,
you should regard Master Zhi as your teacher.
Later, Zhi passed away.
At that time, Chan Master Zhao was residing at Daoshou.
He was Yue's senior disciple.
Zhi's later affairs were all managed by Zhao as the host,
with the propriety of teacher and student.
This is because he did not forget the entrustment.
The master said one day:
Bodhisattvas see the Buddha-nature with their eyes.
One must see it with the eyes.
